name: Delano South Beach Hotel

reviews.title: Delano - a dream
reviews.text: It was one of my dreams to stay once at the Delano when in Miami... I booked through AMEX to receive some extra time for late check-out, a complimentary room-upgrade and a designated extra service at the hotel which turned out to be a massage.

reviews.title: SWANK City!
reviews.text: The girl at check-in was rather rude than nice and friendly, did not want to give the upgrade and offered me +30min late check out (that should be until 4 pm!) so I had to talk to her and convince her that this is not for negotiatinos, onyl the uprade. Finally her manager gave me the uprade and late check-out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The design is absolutely amazing, I also loved the music.
reviews.title: Pretentious for plastic people

likes.liked: — The hotel design was very cool

reviews.text: Sushi at the Bar is perfect, had fun with that long table where you just sit down to other ppl and talk like a big family :)
reviews.title: The Delano becomes more amazing with each visit
Good looking but little substance
reviews.text: Its a bit annoying that upon arrival you receive a card that has to be presented at every outlet and on the beach to make sure you are a hotel guest but i can understand it as there are lots of tourists just walking in and checking the desing :)

Having read reviews on Tripadvisor before we went, we knew that some people complained about the noise from the late night partying at the bar. When we checked in to our room on Christmas (room 401) we asked the front desk clerk about the noise in the room because it was on a relatively lower floor. We were assured by the friendly staff person that it should not be a problem. Well it was. A huge problem. The music was so loud we could actually feel the bass reverberate in our bed. The next morning I complained to a front desk person (a different one) who assured me that the noise level was due to the Christmas partying and that it wouldn't be a problem normally. Well it was just as bad the next night. I complained to the manager in the morning who was very nice and promised to speak to the bar manager about lowering the music. Whether he did or didn't I don't know but the music was just as loud that night. I called the night manager who also was very nice and equally ineffective. The best she could do was offer me ear plugs. For $900 per night (holiday rates) I really don't think I should have to wear ear plugs to get to sleep before 2 AM. The hotel was lovely but after not sleeping well for four straight nights I would rather have stayed in a lesser hotel with a quieter bar scene.
reviews.title: Noise ruined our experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NO make-up mirrors,no shower cap,the lock on the door which is battery operated breaks down all the time which makes it not safe,never got the breakfast order correct,did not get the room i reserved with king sized bed which i booked directly to the hotel,beach attendents were rude and one said "if he had a gun i would kill all the birds on the beach",otherwise the hotel is acceptable!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Improvements Needed!!!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — THE LOCK TO THE ROOM NOT SAFE

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: Just spent a weekend in Delano. What an amazing place. Didn.t even need to leave the hotel for 2 days. The staff were great, loved the concierge. Rooms still look fresh after all these years. The pool area is great hang hang, night and day. I will be back..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Delano. My girlfriend and I wanted to chill out for a bit more than a week and we wanted a pool and beach easily accessible. We came to Miami as with the dollar rate right now, our Euro took us a long way. Hence it was also a bit easier to swallow the price of this hotel (in addition to the other outrageous costs in South Beach....not mentioning the idiotic practice of automatically including gratuity on every restaurant bill). By the way, this will be a long review as I'm writing it at the airport bored out of my mind waiting for a flight.
reviews.title: Ratings here are overblown! Not bad but hyped by reviewers!

likes.disliked: — The overdone praise on review websites.

reviews.text: What did I like? Well, I found service to be quite good. I didn't experience the foot massages at the pool (never saw this on any of the days there and spent lots of time by the pool) but in general, I found the staff very helpful. We also disliked the fact that we needed to come down fairly early to reserve good poolside loungers and I guess since I didn't tip the poolboy, I wasn't automatically given one. I was simply told it's first come, first served in the morning. Yet, the poolstaff were always cordial and helpful with basics. I found one of the ladies serving food and drinks to be a bit disinterested but again, maybe I simply didn't grease enough palms. The reception was also always very polite and generally helpful as was the concierge. I didn't really feel though that anyone went out of their way except for one individual. I was up very early the first day due to jet lag and the guy working the front desk at 4am gave me a weeklong pass for wireless LAN. I believe they charged for this otherwise so this was a very nice amenity as I know wLAN can be ridiculously expensive at US hotels. Further, I found the ground floor to be stylish and it offered a very nice "air about the place". I've been to many designer hotels though and it wasn't outstanding, just fairly nice. The beds in the room are also worth noting as they were very comfortable. I also found the room cleaning to be very good and the couple of times I asked maids for something, they were more than happy to oblige, be it additional towels, or whatever. One positive also worth mentioning is that I called ahead of time looking to speak with Ellis, the customer relations manager. He was no vacation and I spoke to Amanda who was super nice and without even trying, offered to upgrade out room to oceanview instead of cityview as we really wanted this. It was worth the effort as waking up in the morning to a beautiful sunrise added to the effect of being in Miami. Maybe this isn't a big deal, but it meant a lot to us in terms of what we were looking to get out of our vacation. Thank you Amanda!
reviews.title: True Pardise in Miami Beach!

likes.disliked: — Room/Beds were a bit small - but thats the idea!

reviews.title: Very Swanky Hotel
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Delano for his company trip. When we pulled up the building, like most in South Beach, looked really run down. However as soon as we pulled up the driveway my impression changed. While we were waiting to check in we were given cold lemonade. The lobby area and downstairs was interesting...very chic. Our room was different from any room I have ever stayed in. Everything was white, silver or mirrored, very modern. The bed was heavenly, wish we could have taken the comforter home with us. We had a nice view of the city and the room was quite large except the bathroom was pretty small. The pool area was ok, kinda reminded me of the Peninsula Hotel in Bev Hills with all the cabanas. The pool boys and servers were very attentive. Loved the person that came around and gave us free hand and foot massages! Food was outrageously expensive, but where isn't it expesnive in SB? I would love to stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were extremely impressed with this hotel. So impressed that we wrote this review, which is something we have never done before. To give you an idea of where we are coming from, we visit Miami twice a year. We travel often, and in the last several years have been to Paris, LA, Chicago, the UK, and the Bahamas. So it’s not as though we were just seduced by the first nice hotel we stayed at.
reviews.title: The Delano handles it's business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as you arrive here, you realize this is not just another hotel. The lobby architecture and design is superlative. More importantly, as we were checking in we had our first encounter with what came to be the most distinctive feature of the Delano, the outstanding service. As we were checking in, one of the managers, Ellis, introduced himself and assured us that if we needed anything, he would readily assist. He also introduced us to the concierge, Rio, who invited us to speak to him anytime about reservations etc.
reviews.title: Great pool, friendly service but small standard rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is spectacular. The pictures speak for themselves. The quality service extended to the pool. To put it in perspective, they have a pool concierge, Jay, who asked us on several occasions, on both days we sat by the pool, whether she could do anything for us. And we did ask her to take care of a couple of things for us. And she did. There was always a server nearby to take our drink order. Even the poolside music is perfect.
reviews.title: Great time...friendly and helpful staff
Only the pool is worth it
reviews.text: The food was always top-notch: poolside; at Blue Sea; even the room service burgers and wings at 4 am.

reviews.title: Beautiful product, crap service!!
reviews.text: Did not stay at the hotel, simply "went for a drink".

reviews.title: Above and Beyond
reviews.text: On the Tuesday evening we could not get in, queue probably 50 strong, and well we just did not look like the the beautiful people at the front of the line. It turns out Tuesday is party night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not give up, came a little earlier on Wednesday, very quiet... but absolutely sensational design, minimal, sexy, great attn to details, great zoning of tables, gush gush gush... simply fab!!
reviews.title: The reason I love South Beach

likes.liked: — Pool, rooms, service, food, mojitos, atmosphere, spa
likes.disliked: — That block across the street with the Burger King that separates Delano from Lincoln Rd.

reviews.text: Had a very pleasant drink at the pool bar near the private beach, however quite cold, so wandered up to the terrace and sat. Waited, waited and waited, as we were talking time was going by, stopped a server after 20 minutes to be told he was too busy!!! After another 10 minutes we wrote the order down and gave it to a server who advised us he would pass it on to the correct server(??)
reviews.title: Excellent Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 15 minutes later half our drinks arrived, 15 minutes later completion!!
reviews.title: spring break,a decade later

description: Located in the heart of South Beach and directly on the ocean, Delano is the ultimate world-class urban resort and self-contained destination. Boasting America's first Indoor/Outdoor Lobby, the hotel's public spaces create the feeling of an interwoven "village" with almost no separation between indoors and out. With its soaring and unforgettably beautiful Lobby, legendary white Guestrooms, lushly landscaped Orchard, breathtaking Pool, the renowned Club Essentia wellness center and spa and stunning private beach, Delano epitomizes Simple Chic for a modern world. Delano offers seasonal packages and special offers including spa, breakfast and parking packages.
